notes.note: To be placed on the waitlist, please contact Andrea Poag at alp232@cornell.edu.

Only Communication majors and CALS students can enroll online. If unable to enroll, you must attend the lecture you want to add the first day of classes, but this does not guarantee enrollment. Communication majors and CALS seniors will have priority. For questions, contact Andrea Poag alp232@cornell.edu

Prerequisites: 6 credits college level writing courses or junior standing, and Comm 1101. The course is designed for Communication majors.
Prerequisites: 6 credits college level writing courses or junior standing, and Comm 1101. The course is designed for Communication majors.
Prerequisite: COMM 1101.
Students from all colleges must register for course by completing an Independent Study Form (Available in 334 Kennedy). Forms must be returned to 334 Kennedy.
Enrollment is limited to: juniors or seniors. Prerequisite: at least one college-level writing course.
Prerequisite: COMM/STS 3020, ENGRC 3500, or permission of instructor.

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Writing and Editing for Magazines and Online Media

notes.note: Enrollment is limited to: juniors or seniors. Prerequisite: COMM 2310 or equivalent. Preference given to COMM majors. Laptop required.

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Writing and Editing for Magazines and Online Media

notes.note: Enrollment is limited to: juniors or seniors. Prerequisite: COMM 2310 or equivalent. Preference given to COMM majors. Laptop required.
Prerequisite: COMM 2200 or HD 2300.
Prerequisites: COMM 2450 or COMM 2760.
Prerequisite or co-requisite: COMM 2820 or equivalent, social research course, and one semester of introductory statistics.
Prerequisite or co-requisite: present or past undergraduate teaching assistant for COMM course. Enrollment is limited to: juniors or seniors.

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Information Policy: Research, Analysis, and Design

notes.note: Enrollment is limited to: juniors, seniors, or graduate students or permission of instructor.

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Ethics in New Media, Technology, and Communication

notes.note: Prerequisite: COMM/INFO 3450 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: COMM 2450 and COMM 2820 or equivalent.

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Public Communication of Science and Technology

notes.note: Prerequisites: COMM/INFO 2450 or COMM/INFO 3450 or instructor permission.
Prerequisite: COMM/INFO 3450 or permission of instructor.

Enrollment limited to: COMM majors or minors (first-, second-, third-, or fourth-year) for 1 credit (minimum 60 hours). May be repeated once for a total of 2 credits. Enroll online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study.

Prerequisite: 3.0 GPA. May be repeated up to 6 credits with different supervising faculty member. Students must register using independent study form Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study.

1-3 credits; may be repeated to 6 credits with different courses. Intended for undergraduates desiring classroom teaching experience. Prerequisite: junior or senior standing; 3.0 GPA (2.7 if teaching assistant for skills development course); permission of faculty member who supervises work and assigns grade. Students must register using independent study form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study).

Prerequisite: 3.0 GPA. Enrollment limited to: seniors. May be repeated to 6 credits. Students must register using independent study form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study).

course.subject: COMM
course.course_title: Independent Honors Research in Social Science
course.class_descr: Ind Honors Res in Soc Science

notes.note: Prerequisite: requirements for honors program. Enrollment limited to: undergraduates. Enrollment preference given to: students pursuing the research honors thesis in Communication. Students must complete the CALS Honors program application by the third week of the fall semester of their senior year. Students should select a faculty advisor and begin proposal development during their junior year. submit an Independent Study Form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study).
Enrollment limited to: graduate students. The class will be offered all day Sat/Sun 1-3 March 2013.
Enrollment limited to: graduate students.
Prerequisite: COMM 6800 or graduate standing.
Prerequisite: COMM 6820 and graduate standing.
